name: Simple Matzo Meal Latkes
description: With Passover coming up, we wanted to know what Arthur Schwartz (author of Jewish Home Cooking and many other wonderful cookbooks) likes to do with a box of Matzo Meal. He shared this recipe, a humble one, he says, that rarely appears in cookbooks. Whenever matzo meal latke recipes are published, they're gussied up in some way—apples are added, sugar and spice is added, grated lemon peel. You get the picture. But these are simple.
recipeIngredient: Vegetable oil, chicken fat, or butter for frying

recipeInstructions.text: In a mixing bowl, beat together the eggs, water, salt, matzoh meal, and sugar, if using. Let stand 5 minutes. The mixture should be thick but pourable.
In a skillet, heat enough oil, chicken fat or butter to coat the bottom by barely 1/8-inch.

Using a scant 1/4 cup batter for each pancake, drop the batter into the hot fat. It should start sizzling immediately. Fry until lightly browned, then flip the pancake over and fry on the second side.
Continue with all the batter, adding water to it if it thickens too much, and adding more fat to the pan, if needed.
For very fluffy pancakes, separate the eggs, mix the yolk with the batter, then beat the whites and fold them in.
